rows.title: When to wash your hands
rows.introduction: Here are some of the times you need to wash your hands.
rows.content_1:
* Before, during, and after preparing food.Before and after eating.
* After using the toilet or changing a child’s diapers
* After blowing your nose, coughing, or sneezing.
* After touching your pet or animal food.
* Before and after treating a cut or wound.
* After leaving a public place.
* After touching garbage.
* Before and after using your mask.
* Before and after caring for someone at home who is sick.

rows.title: General rules of hand hygiene.
rows.content_1:
* Keep your nails short and without polish.
* Do not wear glued nails.
* Wear clothes with short sleeves.
* Use disposable paper towels to dry your hands.
* Avoid wearing jewelry on your hands.

rows.title: Steps to wash your hands
rows.content_1: Use plain soap and water and scrub the backs of your hands, between your fingers, and under your nails for at least 20 seconds. Need a timer? Sing the “Happy Birthday” song from beginning to end twice. Rinse hands, then dry with a clean towel.

rows.title: Steps on how to clean our environment
rows.introduction: Here are some steps that can be followed to keep our surrounding clean
